formula: a(n) = 0 iff n has an odd number of digits in binary, = 1 otherwise. - _Henry Bottomley_, Apr 06 2000a(n) = (1/2)*{1-(-1)^floor(log(n)/log(2))}. - _Benoit Cloitre_, Nov 22 2001a(n) = 1-a(floor(n/2)). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Aug 04 2003
prog: (PARI) a(n)=if(n<1,0,1-length(binary(n))%2)(PARI) a(n)=if(n<1,0,if(n%2==0,-a(n/2)+1,-a((n-1)/2)+1-(((n-1)/2)==0))) /* _Ralf Stephan_ */(MAGMA) [Floor(Log(n)/Log(2)) mod 2: n in [1..100]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jun 23 2015
